Reviews.Title: No glow infrared that neither animals nor people see!
Reviews.Author: SierraC "Celestial"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } // ]]> var cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71Co5uchz3S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay) { cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71Co5uchz3S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71Co5uchz3S._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36preplay.parentNode; var cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36currentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36currentClick) { return cv_mo70AFQ7E7GD36currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:56 MinsI don't know if I'm allowed to post a separate video, so I'm making this a video review so you can see for yourself the video this camera made of a bear that visits my property. Please keep in mind that the clip was woven together from about a dozen ten second videos taken during two periods on Halloween evening. You'll see our dog suddenly appear where the bear was, but in fact they were not in the same spot at the same time. Combining all the clips into one is more interesting but you will need to be aware of the time stamp at the bottom.Anyway, we love the camera and wish we had half a dozen more. I see there is a rebate right now, so I may go ahead and get another immediately. We have learned so much about all the activity on our property after we lock up the chicken coop, close all the gates, and go inside at night. It's a whole different world out there once it's dark, full of bear, deer, raccoons, and more. We see that our dog and cats stay busy!I will also post some still shots that clearly show the trigger is plenty fast to catch most activity. My only problem is that I am getting shots with no animals in them. I think that's due to the fact that it has been very windy and I have the motion detector set at high. But it's easy enough to change and there are other options. All the controls are easy to use. The unit doesn't run through batteries too quickly. The case closes securely, so I have no current concern about rain getting inside. The temperature sensor has been very helpful, too. The fact that the IR is no glow means that neither animals nor people see the flash when it goes off. I have caught animals as far as 30 feet away although they were silhouetted and not perfectly clear. There is a lot to love about this Bushnell. Take a look at my images and I think you'll agree!

Reviews.Title: You Need to Know - that a Special Down loadable Viewer / Player is Needed .
Reviews.Author: Kathy Lawrence
Reviews.Content: The File Format is :  EK00008  type Name which Plays on -  ( DivX Player - version 10.0.0 )  etc.I would also Buy the  Metal Lock Box to Protect the Unit or Units  You buy !It seems Customer Service doesn't  Know this or Amazon Support - that - Sell the Item !After Much Testing :  All is Well and the Unit preforms as stated _ It how ever uses a lot of Memory in High Traffic Area's .I would Order a 32 Gig  San Disc  Memory card.  I'm in a High Traffic Area I have the 16 Gig card and get about 4-5 Days .My Settings are Low for sensitivity and Medium for Black Led lighting ( 640 x 480 ) Video Size - which saves Battery life andgets very good Quality Video - on smaller file Size .. // Picking up cars at 65-70 ft. as Far as Triggering is concerned . If You Turn up the Sensitivity to  HIGH  You will pick up  Moths and movement of Leaves 20 ft away will Trigger .It took Me 2 Weeks to get all the Bugs  Ironed Out as I kept getting the Wrong Answers from everyone  - / -  Hope  You read this As it will  Save  You  the 2 Weeks of calls and Testing .

Reviews.Title: The only trail camera you will ever need.
Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I currently have three of these cameras, the black  LEDs are a must if you want to photograph mature whitetail bucks. I have another brand of trail cam that has the infrared LEDs and have pictures of deer feeding until the first picture is taken, then the deer are looking directly at the camera. I have never experenced this with the Bushnell HD Black LED trail camera. The night time pictures are a little grainy, but that is to be expected with the lower MPs for night time pictures. Maybe in the future they will have the technology to increase the MPs for night time pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: Unfit for its intended purpose
Reviews.Author: John H. Meyer
Reviews.Content: This product is not up to Bushnell's high standards. I will be returning it tomorrow.Problems:1. The motion sensor only triggers at a range of twenty feet or less. I tested this with sensitivity first set to "Auto," and then later to "High." The ambient temperature was 62 degrees; there was a very slight breeze, and the camera was pointed into a level, open clearing. I walked across the field of view at various distances, and was only able to get reliable triggering at fifteen feet. I got no triggering whatsoever beyond twenty feet.This is unacceptable and renders the product useless for its intended purpose. I had been warned by one long-time user of trail cameras that Bushnell cameras are known for poor sensitivity, but I liked the feature set and trusted the Bushnell name and therefore purchased the product anyway.2. The still picture quality is horrible. Bushnell advertises the number of pixels as "8 megapixels" but that specification contains an inherent promise that the sensor and lens system can actually resolve details to that level. In fact, it is clear that the sensor is capable of resolving far less detail than that, and all the camera is doing is "up-resing" from a cheap, low-pixel sensor.3. The video image is most definitely NOT HD. I am in the video business, and have been taking still photos, movies, and now videos since the 1950s. I know what HD video can look like and work with cameras as varied as prosumer Sony camcorders to cell phones to Hero HD cameras. The video produced by this camera is the worst video I have seen from any source since the original cell phone videos ten years ago.It may be 1280x720, but it is NOT HD!!4. The battery holder does not hold the batteries in place unless you fill it with all eight batteries. If you only use four batteries, any slight bump will cause the batteries to pop out sideways, rendering the camera inoperative.I tried a variety of different battery types, including fresh alkaline and lithium batteries, but that didn't make any difference at all. I also read the entire manual, and changed every relevant menu setting.Update (November 19, 2013):I purchased a Moultrie M-990i. I tested its trigger range in the exact same location as my test with the Bushnell camera. Instead of no triggering beyond 20 feet, the Moultrie triggered to 70 feet and beyond. The only variable, other than the camera that might have affected this was the time of day: the temperature was almost exactly the same, but it was a little earlier in the day, just before noon.The picture quality on the Moultrie in 4MP mode (I haven't yet been able to get a 10 MP picture) is as good (perhaps a little better) than the Bushnell. If I can get the 10MP mode to work, I'm expecting the quality to be better. The Moultrie case is smaller and better camouflaged. The downside to the Moultrie is that it cannot take still pictures as well as video. On the other hand, the Moultrie video is Motion JPEG which means that it is nothing more than a series of independent still photos. Also, the fast multiple photo mode (up to four photos at a time) is almost video speed.One downside: the Moultrie requires eight batteries, whereas the Bushnell can be run with only four. This is not a big deal for me.So for me, the much cheaper Moultrie performs better.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Earl C.
Reviews.Content: The Bushnell is the perfect trail camera for field or home. I bought mine to use in a residential setting to monitor back yard incursions of local neighborhood wildlife. Works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great All-Weather Performance, there are also indoor applications  Video Attached to this review in HD mode of a Black Bear
Reviews.Author: Freddy the Frog "The Fellowship Of The Feather"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86E', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; var swfWidth = "320"; var swfHeight = "100%"; var flashVersion = "9.0.115"; var bgColor = "#FFFFFF"; var swfParams = {}; var flashParams = {}; var embedAttributes = {}; swfParams.amazonPort = "80"; swfParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; swfParams.telemetrySubPageType = "VideoReview"; swfParams.nsPrefix = "cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86E"; swfParams.locale = "en_US"; swfParams.logUrl = "gp/mpd/l"; swfParams.canResize = "1"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; swfParams.sessionId = "000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.marketplaceID = "ATVPDKIKX0DER"; swfParams.salign = "LT"; swfParams.preset = "detail"; swfParams.mediaObjectId = "m1LCE0OCLPNN4G"; swfParams.autoPlayTimer = ""; swfParams.mediaObjectIDList = "m1LCE0OCLPNN4G"; swfParams.playIsUserGenerated = "1"; swfParams.enableShare = "0"; swfParams.permUrl = "gp/mpd/permalink"; swfParams.telemetryPageTypeID = "R1IICSZ0J9RFGK"; swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/m1LCE0OCLPNN4G/000-0000000-0000000"; swfParams.amazonServer = "www.amazon.com"; swfParams.scale = "noscale"; flashParams.allowFullScreen = "true"; flashParams.salign = "LT"; flashParams.bgcolor = "#FFFFFF"; flashParams.allowScriptAccess = "always"; flashParams.quality = "high"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; embedAttributes.title = "Flash Player"; if (movieID){ if (playerVersion == '3'){ swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; swfParams.mediaObjectIDList = movieID; } else { swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/legacy/20101014901/AMPlayerProd._V197491872_.swf"; } swfParams.xmlUrl = "http://www.amazon.com/gp/mpd/getplaylist-v2/" + movieID + "/000-0000000-0000000"; flashParams.wmode = "transparent"; swfParams.autoPlay = "1"; } if (document.getElementById('cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Eduration')) { document.getElementById('cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Eduration').style.display='none'; } cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EloadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86ERollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86ERollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81IqGinRRyS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EpreplayImageId'); if (cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay) { cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81IqGinRRyS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81IqGinRRyS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86Epreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2U0OYOKXNO86EcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:47 MinsMy First introduction to these cameras was for home surveillance and security...That quickly moved to many other uses. I've been using these cameras (Bushnell Trophy Cam Model 119576C) for several months now and am comfortable providing a somewhat useful review at this point.I use them all in Hybrid Mode; video and still images together, wide-screen setting.I leave the Sensor Level on Auto.These cameras have helped me solve many mysteries... the first being, the mice who were taking the cheese and cleaning the peanut butter from my traps? That's right, I set up a Trophy Cam inside a closet in the basement... placed the traps four feet away... it faithfully provided stills and video of the super smart mouse who was visiting my traps... observing their behavior helped me better place the traps and also view where the mice were emerging from. Now, no more mice and great mouse video footage. So, the sensor triggers even for critters as small as house and deer mice.I leave the shutter speed set to Medium... I've found that this provides nice, pretty darn clear images of moving animals and yes, even birds on occasion. Turkeys walking through the woods, crows coming to road kill and so on. Even squirrels running along fallen trees were captured.I changed out the cards from 8 gigs to 16 gigs... lesson learned "after" I realized I had missed a great opportunity to video a bear, but the card was full! Once the data card is full... that's it. It doesn't cascade date by overwriting the card (would be great if they did).Video and Stills were faithfully recorded in temps as low as -6 deg. F. as I bumped up the video length to 60 seconds (max allowed) the batteries (12 AA eneloop rechargeable) lasted about 9 weeks. However, that's because there are a lot of deer traffic, raccoons, possum, fisher cat and turkey all making frequent trips along the trail where I posted the cameras.It's useful to have two, three even better, placed at several angles or stages for maximum coverage of a location. I find that each camera will add night light to the subject (invisible to us and animals of course) that will enhance the view/lighting... in my video of the black bear, you can see another camera kick on and back light the bear... GREAT enhancement!I also bumped the interval down to 5 seconds (default is 10) to make sure and get maximum coverage of the animals passing through. Nothing worse than just seeing the tail end of something cool... with no follow-up video.Putting up a post for the cameras, or even a tri-pod (base has thread size perfect for tri-pod mounting) is a mistake, I soon learned that deer and other wildlife pay attention to changes like that. Placing the cameras on large-diameter trees seems to make them invisible to wild life, even just two feet from the ground.At four feet from the ground, the cameras were picking up movement 40 feet from the camera IN the woods.... My target area is much closer as my intent is to get close, detailed video and stills of wild life. My prime target distance is circa 10 feet, so the LED control is set to MED. On High, not only does that use more battery resources, but blows out close up animals. In the closed, chicken coop and garage where I was videoing mice, the LED power was set to LOW.... for 4 feet from the camera... great results.I leave the resolution setting on 1280 x 720, which is the max size.I use SanDisk Extreme series SD cards. flawless performance in all weather conditions.Video Sound is left ON and in the absence of wind, is very effective... hearing animals walking through the leaves, birds singing in early morning, bear breathing, something walking "behind" the camera... sound is a huge bonus!ENGRAVE THE CAM; game/trophy cams are easily stolen... I engrave the exterior of each cam... vibro etcher works nice, and then I rub pigment into the etched plastic surface... no one wants to steal a cam with someone else's name on it!Furthermore, when programming your cam, you can enter a name... I input location info, so that when I'm editing, I know which cam the data came from. WoodsEast, SthMeadow, MouseCam... and so on... helps when editing from multiple cams.EDITING your data.... Ok, this was a problem for me... I do lots of video and photo editing and use Adobe Premiere Pro for video... top of the line editing program and guess what? The avi. files from these Trophy Cams are NOT compatible with adobe... and I could not find a plug-in for that. BUT, the files work in Windows Movie Maker (comes with most Microsoft/Windows computers)... so, minor inconvenience... I "could" render the video in Windows Movie Maker and then export it and then... import it to Adobe... but that's just too much of a hassle... I just render the Trophy cam footage with Windows Media and leave it at that.Though the video and images are HD.... these units are really informational rather than a "creative tool"... you won't be composing and editing your next indie film with data from a trophy cam. Nevertheless, you will be informed about all living creatures that pass in front of them, and that's the real joy in owning trophy cams.They are absolutely effective as a witness to all things living around your property and in your cupboards, closets and basements... you can monitor your driveway, storage shed, garage, backyard or anywhere else you may want to know who comes and goes.... live in rural America and want to know who is bashing your mail box off the post? Put a trophy cam out there and get it all.... who is stealing those spiffy road signs? Trophy cam... gotcha!Can't beat them for the price... I am completely happy with their performance and would absolutely endorse them to any friend or neighbor. Designed for hunters, but just as good for wild life observers and people who are just plain curious about what goes on at night or when you're away...

Reviews.Title: Takes great daytime photos
Reviews.Author: Trum979 "Truman"
Reviews.Content: I have several trail cameras and this is one of the best I have tried. The trigger speed is .6 seconds, so it dose not miss much. The only drawback is that the night photos are pretty grainy and washed out. I suppose due to the blackout feature over the infrared. Over- all a better than average gamecam.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam
Reviews.Author: James F. Purdon
Reviews.Content: This "critter cam" works as advertised.  The camera takes great photos and is very sturdy!  As usual, Bushnell products are top of the line.

Reviews.Title: Unconventional use
Reviews.Author: JRM "JRM in Ohio"
Reviews.Content: I am using this to photo cars entering and exiting my driveway...it's working pretty well.  Not 100% but pretty well.  I get about 85% readability of license plates of those cars...had to reposition the camera so the car is moving side to side...doesn't trigger early enough when the car is moving straight at the camera.  At night it's much less effective...the plates get over exposed and hard to read.

Reviews.Title: Long battery life
Reviews.Author: Dale E Triplett
Reviews.Content: Great trail camera takes  great pics and videos with sound. Batteries lasted for 4000 pics and 500 videos. Wiil buy another.

Reviews.Title: best product
Reviews.Author: Robert Theroux
Reviews.Content: I have purchased other makes before and now have 3 bushnell cameras and love them.easy to operate,battery life is beyond expectation,and they videos and pictures are very acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Not for cold regions!
Reviews.Author: WhoDunnit Buff
Reviews.Content: This product does a nice job until the temp gets to -4 when the movie feature stops working. (That's been nearly every day since November in northern MN!) It still takes photos at lower temps but misses blocks of activity for hours at a time even in warmer temps. The insulation on the small wire going from the batteries to the camera broke within days although it still seems to be working. The company charges $10 shipping to send it in for repair even under warranty. I wish I would have purchased this from a store instead of Amazon. I would have returned it!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, good price, lightweight, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago and I can say I've had great luck with it! Very easy to program, small and compact for easier hiding on trees. The strap is nice and long so you can place it on a ton of different sized trees. Only thing I don't like is that the camera only takes pictures of moving objects closer than 25-30 feet. I haven't gotten any farther away than that. I've walked around 40-50 feet away trying to get spotted but I haven't had it get any pictures until I've gotten about 25-30 feet away. I've tried with the sensor on all the different levels of sensitivity but no luck. So I've just placed my camera closer to my feed spots that's all.

Reviews.Title: First one was great
Reviews.Author: Dreamcatcher "Douglas"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Trophy Cam HD Max Black.  The first one was fantastic, I loved it.  Returned because Raycon batteries I purchased from Amazon and installed in the camera leaked battery acid covering the compartment.  Amazon Support was outstanding.  Knowing that I was unable to clean the compartment completely, the camera was replaced with another of the same.  The replacement however did not work as well as the first.  Many times did not take video when it should have.  I watched with my Yukon Night Scope on several evenings as Racoons, Possum, and my neighbors Cat passed in front of the camera and no video was taken. This time I am asking for a refund, not a replacement. I'm waiting for the new Bushnell Trophy Cam HD Max coming out in May of this year.  This Trophy Cam HD Max features a new aggressively styled body, new latch system and a removable anti-reflection cover for the LEDs to minimize visibility to game and other hunters.  It's also the first Trophy Cam to shoot video in super high 1920x1080p resolution.  Because I believe there is no place better than Amazon.com to make my purchases, I will wait until May (hopefully) for it to become available here.

Reviews.Title: Love the blk.out version
Reviews.Author: tracy nordike
Reviews.Content: Only issue is night photos at about 30 ft. Away are dull and blurry. But besides that I already have another model from bushnell and would have no other

Reviews.Title: Defective camera
Reviews.Author: Billie D Bickford
Reviews.Content: The brand new camera is destroyed because something caused all 12 brand new batteries to leak within less than 24 hr after insertion.UPDATE:  It appears there is a defective spring in the camera which causes the batteries to short out. Amazon Customer Service is currently replacing the item so, hopefully, the new camera will function as advertised. A friend has this same camera and is very pleased with its performance as well as the quality of the images.

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: Dean08 "Dean"
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I could monitor deer coming into our back yard at night.  Very disappointed in this product, first off the sensor was being activated when nothing was in the field of view, this was on a calm night, tried changing the sensitivity but it made no difference.Second, based on the term 'HD' in the product description I was expecting semi-decent picture quality.  I don't expect perfect HD quality when it is dark outside but what I get is extremely grainy pictures which are hard to make out what is in the picture, basically unless there is some light source nearby it does not work for the purpose I bought it.  Video and picture quality in the dark is very poor.I'm returning the item to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Gregory Fahrenbach
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of the black flash.  During its first use I had deer come right up to the camera at night.  I also really enjoyed the video quality.  At some point I will buy another.

Reviews.Title: game camera misses the bullseye
Reviews.Author: Steven Radtke
Reviews.Content: pro:effective motion sense day and nightday time color HD pictures are sharpsnaps or videos or bothcon:nothing at all to aim and frameif timestamps are used on photos, the Bushnell logo is placed on the photo - their name on my photo - what is that???

Reviews.Title: Well built and performs fairly well
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Morgan
Reviews.Content: It will not trigger if it mounted behind a glass window. That hadn't crossed my mind when I bought it. It picks up images acceptably in the dark. The batteries last a long time. The programming method is bit hokey. It lacks the ability to be programmed to shoot video at a preset time for 5 minutes or more. The video will shoot for a max of 1 minute. The field scan option does not appear to work exactly as described. Also the strapping brackets on the back side need to be bigger to allow more types of locking mechanisms. It does not turn any lights on nor make any noises when it is shooting a photo or video, which is perfect. I would say it needs three additional features to make it perfect: 1. USB interface to  software on PC to program it and 2. the ability to shoot as much video as you want at several preset times, and 3. a button that turns on a bluetooth wireless connection so you can review or capture pictures/videos with a smart phone without dismounting it from a tree or shooting location.

Reviews.Title: The Night Vision makes this worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: dan b
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased to "catch a thief" who was stealing cars and parts during hours of darkness.  While he was smart enough to find one camera that did not have the night vision, he was caught in the act the very first night this camera was installed. This is a great tool for law enforcement.

Reviews.Title: camera found our "problems"!
Reviews.Author: John Crowther
Reviews.Content: Excellent product! Clear color pictures during daylight hours. Nighttime photos are in black and white and range from clear to somewhat blurred depending upon the motion of the subject being photographed and its distance from the camera (clearer at a distance of over 10 feet and clearer if stationery or moving slowly). Living on 8 acres of fairly heavily-wooded property, we had recently been having problems with trash cans being overturned on a regular basis (and 7 attempted break ins over the past 20 years). Yesterday, the camera revealed our "problems"--in addition to the turkeys, squirrels, raccoons, dogs, our pet cat, the birds and the UPS driver who delighted in driving through the woods (and off the driveway) where he should not have been, all caught by the camera, we now know that we have 3 black bears (2 very large and 1 cub) wandering around here. The ability to choose between still shots and videos, with a new feature which allows a hybrid choice of BOTH a still shot and a video, is  a real plus. Additional cameras have been ordered and will be placed around the property for security/surveillance purposes, enabling us to photograph the faces (and if driving a vehicle, the license plates) of everyone/anyone who enters the property along the 660 foot driveway and elsewhere.a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a a

Reviews.Title: HELP
Reviews.Author: James Carter
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews I read before purchasing said it was easy to use and set up.  Not so. Truthfully it might be me, but I find the the setup procedure very difficult. I own a manufacturing company, so I'm not a non-mechanical - non- electronic novice. As to the performance -- when I figure out how to set it up I'll let you know.  Thank you  Jim C.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera and battery life
Reviews.Author: T. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Love the video, The video tells you so much more, I like to use the pic and video combo (Hybrid) setting. I am curious, even though you cannot see the flash or hear the camera initiate, the deer still seem to get spooked at times. But the deer still come back.

Reviews.Title: Captures all kinds of critters
Reviews.Author: Yamhellian
Reviews.Content: Day time video is very good, night time video is grainy.  Still shots are excellent, but the infared trigger seems to be slow.

Reviews.Title: Here's the Trophy for your Buck!
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: Great Cam!! I wish it could be more than 8MP. For the price you can't beat it! I love that it doesn't flash so no-one or animals know that they are on Camera! The bad thing is the back...It's strap holder is too tight! very hard to put a wirestrap to lock it down to prevent theft!. Houston there's a problem here!! Other than that go get yourself one!

Reviews.Title: trail cam
Reviews.Author: Hans Dalke
Reviews.Content: Outstanding picture quality.  Good IR pics as well.  Delivery as promised. Would like to have seen integral display and navigation directions could have been written better but the camera itself is great.

Reviews.Title: Stands test of time
Reviews.Author: Pellet Grill Team
Reviews.Content: I just ordered my third Trophy Cam.  I put camera number one in use and was satisfied, then bought cam number two (both last year), now adding a third to my hunting efforts.  Cams 1 and 2 have been in the field for over a year each, and I have good reviews of both.  I use Sanyo eneloop rechargeable AA batts and find I get at least 2 months between recharges.  Add to that that my cams are very active (I get 700-1000 images per week) and I can attest to a very good battery life with this camera.The daytime pics are sharp and clear.  I cant say anything about video since I never use this mode.  Night pics are lower quality as expected, but I can easily count the points on each buck's rack from 40'.  I try to keep the cam out of the way of animals since I have tons of wild boars and a resident black bear.  The animals are not aware of the camera since it doesnt flash, but they do lots of rubbing on trees scratching themselves.For a $200 camera, I have been very happy with their reliabilty and quality.  I wouldnt hesitate to suggest this camera to friends.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam HD Max Black LED Trail Camera with Night Vision
Reviews.Author: D M R
Reviews.Content: Camera works as advertised. I like the night vision option. There isn't a detectible flash that startles the deer, and they have gotten within a few feet of the camera. I'm still trying to fine tune which options will work best for me. Make sure you get a flash memory card to use with this, as it will hold a lot more photos and videos. It also makes transferring to a computer much easier.

Reviews.Title: not bad, not good
Reviews.Author: charles okazaki
Reviews.Content: motion sensor is "so so"pictures are blurry most of the time on moving objects.if a good picture is captured, it is clear

Reviews.Title: Great for different uses.
Reviews.Author: chuckieann
Reviews.Content: Works great for the real reason I need it. I have several uses for this camera other than hunting game.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell black LED trail cam
Reviews.Author: kansasbull
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these, and they do a great job. The batteries last a long time, they take good pictures, and the deer and elk don't get spooked by them. I put them in the metal boxes, because one of my early cameras got knocked off of a tree into a pond where it expired. The elk was fine.

Reviews.Title: My camera stopped working after 1 day --- Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Rob
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera with high expectations after reading reviews and looking at a lot of options.  It worked fine for one day and then stopped working.  LCD does not work at all.  I am returning to Bushnell.  Not what I expected from this brand.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Cookie McKee
Reviews.Content: It does take lots of batteries but it is a good camera and easy to use. The price seemed fair also.

Reviews.Title: Great day pics and good night time pics
Reviews.Author: Austin R Langner
Reviews.Content: This game cam takes great pictures in good to poor light. The IR lighting does not have the power to really project to far from the camera. So far this has been a great product.

Reviews.Title: Much better than expected--and well worth it!
Reviews.Author: Paula M. Uscian
Reviews.Content: I just retrieved my first set of pix and video from this camera and am quite pleased with how well it worked. I set it up just inside the woods outside our cabin in NW WI to see what wildlife came around when we were away. What a pleasant surprise to come back and see both stills and video of various deer, wild turkeys and other critters "doing their thing," both day and night. It also was very informative to see the weather changes over the 3+ weeks we had the camera set up--we saw the snow melt, return and melt away again over that time.Day shots/video come out well up to a distance of 25-35'. Night shots at that distance are harder to discern; many times you know a critter is there only because its eye reflects. When they are closer to the camera, the night video and stills are, of course, much better.I used a 32GB SDHC card and 12 Ray-O-Vac alkaline batteries; the battery gauge still shows full strength and just over 1/32 of the card was used to store over 900 pictures and video clips. You can set up each still shot to have time, temp and (I think) moon phase data noted; videos have a time stamp.Be sure to get all the accessories out of the packaging. The manual mentioned a buckle strap to hold the camera in place and various cables that at first I thought I hadn't gotten. Then I rechecked the packaging and saw these items were tucked into the bottom.This is my first experience with a camera "trap." The manual explains the configuration options clearly and it is easy to set the camera up. I'm going to play with the placement to try for better night stills and video (perhaps in exchange for less screen time, as the critters will be closer in). I now wish I'd bought two of these when Amazon ran a deal on them in early March; I definitely will be watching for the next time they go on sale!

Reviews.Title: Not for this Grannie
Reviews.Author: Twegwert
Reviews.Content: I had to open this to see how I should use it & it was not what I was thinking it was. It has not been used or installed in any way but I had to open it to read the directions. Someone told me this is what I needed to see what wildlife was digging up my yard and I can not figure out how to use it. Is it still returnable? There are even other things I needed to use it and & I did not know this when I bought this camera. Please advise if it is still returnable. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Williams
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at the quality of the pictures that have been taken so far.  I am still learning with this camera about the best settingsfor taking good pictures.  I would recommend this camera for capturing wildlife pictures.

Reviews.Title: Night vision camera
Reviews.Author: Cylyce Newman
Reviews.Content: This is a great hunting product. I bought it for other purposes and needed audio also. Very well made and strong cover to protect it from the weather.

Reviews.Title: He loves it!
Reviews.Author: PAN66
Reviews.Content: We got this as a gift for my father.  He loves it.  I am told that the color blends in very well with the tree so it is difficult even for him to see until he is close to it.  The pictures have been very clear.

Reviews.Title: Excellant Game Camera
Reviews.Author: stormin normin
Reviews.Content: Works great!  Very clear pic's. I have 4 of these cameras. I had a problem with one last year and Bushnell promptly replaced it with a new one.Great trail camera and great company.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Dgtur
Reviews.Content: Excellent photo quality, would be nice if it had more flexability in the timing of the photo taking and the range of activation, but for the price it has 900% of what I need and takes very good pictures.

Reviews.Title: great trail camera
Reviews.Author: K. S. "Costa Rica Kim"
Reviews.Content: These are great motion trail cameras, they work beautifully.  We have a nature lodge in Costa Rica and we get great wildlife shots with these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam HD Max Black
Reviews.Author: William Costa
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately it took three Trail Cam purchases to find this gem.I wanted a Trail Cam to capture some of the abundant wildlife in the area I live in. I started out with the Bushnell 8X HD, but was disappointed at the amount of white/blank photos.  I wanted to take 3 burst photos every 10 mins for a prolonged time period, but almost every other photo was white/blank.  Condensation was a huge problem blurring out a great deal of the overnight photo time.  I then purchased the Moultrie i990.  The manufacturer touted the same options as the Bushnell HD, however you could only use one function at the same time and so, I returned to Bushnell and purchased this Trophy Cam HD Max spending only a few dollars more. The Bushnell Trophy Cam HD Max takes beautiful 8MP photos during the day and exceptional night photos thanks to its Hyper Night Vision.  Condensation has not been an issue.  Unless your setting your Trail Cam a great distance from another device that you can view your photos on, don't bother paying the additional money for the color version as it's difficult to see the photos using the LCD viewer.  I have used the Trail Cam to take 3 photos every 10 minutes for 24 hours, 9 days now and it hasn't missed a picture yet. Well, worth the money and I wish I purchased this Trail Cam the first time around.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ALAN MCDONALD
Reviews.Content: VERY EASY TO USEEVEN TOOK PICS DOWN TO -10 FWITH 32 GB CARD @ 8MP TAKES 10000 PICS +THE BLACK FLASH IS GREAT FOR CATCHING TRESPASSERS

Reviews.Title: I Received one as a gift!
Reviews.Author: pbphillips62
Reviews.Content: Doesn't come with a card.  Low quality night vision. Slow camera operation. One month later half the pictures won't even download, the error code says, can't recognize format…what?  It's the camera that took the pics, how can it not recognize…! Anyway, my advice to you, get it, try it and return it within the right dates; that way, u can figure out some of the features and order the one you want.  I wish i had done that.patrick

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.  Disappointed on reliability-longevity.
Reviews.Author: Ken C
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera exactly 13 months ago, and today it died (despite all obvious resuscitation attempts including the owners manual's instructions).  Until now, it worked pretty well but not great (missed some obvious shots, and pictures weren't as sharp as I hoped).  It has had a very easy life -- never in extreme cold of winter or exposed to heat, but only to take pictures (from a shady tree trunk) of animals that would want to eat from our garden in the growing season -- that is in contrast to how more usual users (hunters in the winter hunting season) would use it, so this camera should have lasted many years.  It had fresh lithium batteries (only a few weeks old) and a quality memory card, so its death is inexplicable -- one night it just stopped taking pictures, and the LCD screen won't even come on in Setup mode.  So I have to rate this camera a single star for the poorest reliability or longevity, and have to caution potential buyers against buying this camera unless they can accept it failing in only a year.  Purchasers are welcome to contact me through Amazon for more details if they wish.

Reviews.Title: Resolution not great
Reviews.Author: Kathy Blacic "kgb"
Reviews.Content: This is our first attempt at photographing wildlife around our pond at night.  Apparently we don't have much action.  The only image we captured was so blurry we couldn't tell what it was.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed in this Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Olson "Seamistress of Longships"
Reviews.Content: I researched cameras very carefully and was sure this would be my best buy. The quality of photo daytime is great , the night time not so much, but understandable.My problem is with the operation of the camera. At first the batteries were the problm, and it takes 12 AA , they burst open from the cold . Energizer stood behind their batteries and replaced them. So I put the new batteries in and put it out again, when I checked , there were some nice deer photos and a fox.  I was excited and put it out again.  I left it for a longer time. Actually I forgot about it , and it was out there for a few months. I expected hundreds of phtos. To my surprise, there were only two photos and those  of my hands as i installed the camera. So for some reason , now it isn't even working. Since I bought it from Amazon, I am not sure , what to do ,as it is past the time for replacement.So 5 months after my purchase, I only got about 30 photos, and a camera that doesn't work. I'm not even sure how to get it fixed, and shouldn't have to be getting it fixed at all.

Reviews.Title: Who is at fault?
Reviews.Author: R. Stalder
Reviews.Content: Received this brand new trail camera and installed 12 Brand New Rayovac batteries. After setting up all of the options, I closed the door and I heard a pop like a gun went off. I opened the cover and saw that a battery had popped open. I took a closer look and 4 more batteries instantly exploded all over my face, my shirt and my table. I grabbed some tweezers and got the remainder of the batteries out quickly before more of them exploded. One more exploded on my table causing some damage.I called Rayovac and they said they would replace the batteries, the camera and my shirt, but it would take 12 weeks. They never even were concerned that their batteries exploded in my face. They read from a script and told me they would send me a UPS label in the mail to return the batteries and any other item I would like to claim. Sorry.. I will never buy these cheap batteries again.. even if they were on sale.I contacted Bushnell and they claim this has never happened before. It was not until today I read a couple of other reviews where this occurred. Neither company is claiming responsibility for their products. I was told that Bushnell would look into this, but I highly doubt it. I filed a return with Amazon and will be sending it back for a full refund. I am at a loss at what is happening here.Were the batteries at fault or the camera? We will never know by the responses I received. Buyer beware..

Reviews.Title: Husband likes it!
Reviews.Author: Shirley Mensch
Reviews.Content: My husband, Harold got this item and he seems to be very happy with it.  I'm happy he is happy!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this product. It does not work.
Reviews.Author: Kayla Woodcock
Reviews.Content: This camera did not work at all. All the pictures were so dark you could not make out what was in them.

ProductInfo.Features:
8 MP high-quality resolution images and 1-3 images per trigger; 1280x720p HD video with audio record (programmable length from 1 to 60 seconds)
Simultaneously capture full resolution images and video on every trigger with Hybrid Capture Mode
Images display date, time, moon, temperature, and barometric pressure
Hyper Passive Infra-Red (PIR) Motion sensor reaches out to 60 feet; 32 No-Glow Black LEDs function as a flash and are invisible to game
SD Card Slot with 32GB capacity (SD Card not included); Includes adjustable web belt and 1/4-20 socket
ProductInfo.Name: Bushnell 8MP Trophy Cam HD Max Black LED Trail Camera with Night Vision (Model #119576C)
